c74object.name: bach.scramble
c74object.digest: Perform a random permutation of an llll
c74object.description: Returns a random permutation of the incoming llll and its sublists.

objarg.name: depths
objarg.description: If there is only one argument, it sets maxdepth. If there are two arguments, they set respectively mindepth and maxdepth.

method.name: llll
method.description: A random permutation of the llll and its sublists, within the depth range set by the mindepth and maxdepth attributes, is returned.

attribute.name: maxdepth
attribute.description: maxdepth sets the maximum depth level at which the operation must be performed. If negative, the depth level is counted from the innermost level of each branch of the tree. A value of 0 is not accepted. Defaults to -1, i.e. there is no limitation (stop at the innermost level).

attribute.name: mindepth
attribute.description: mindepth sets the minimum depth level at which the operation must be performed. If negative, the depth level is counted from the innermost level of each branch of the tree. A value of 0 is not accepted. Defaults to 1, i.e. there is no limitation.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.
